text: My latest statement on the coronavirus case of unknown origin in Santa Clara County:
Washing your hands frequently Covering your mouth when you cough and sneeze Staying home when you’re sick continue to be the most important steps to protect yourself from #COVID19

There’s been a reversal of our progress on tobacco use because of flavored products and a tobacco industry that preys on our nation’s youth. Today the House passed H.R. 2339 to save future generations from a lifetime of addiction.
The President claims the United States has the #coronavirus outbreak “very much under control.” His own policies could threaten that promise.
Bravo to all of the first responders and community members who helped locate Carol Kiparsky and Ian Irwin in Marin County. Our thoughts are with Carol and Ian as they receive care at Marin General.
Tune in to our Election Security Town Hall Meeting in San Jose! @RepZoeLofgren @CASOSvote @PrezPapazian

Thursday, February 20th I’m hosting an in-person Election Security Town Hall Meeting at the @SJSU Hammer Theatre with @RepZoeLofgren @CASOSvote & @PrezPapazian. It'll be a great opportunity to answer questions and hear your concerns. Details & RSVP below!

It’s an honor to have #PanCan survivor @DianeBorrison as my guest at #SOTU. Her presence highlights the national need for affordable health care for every American and robust funding for research and development #StateOfHealthCare
A happy and healthy #LunarNewYear to all those celebrating!
Check out my interview with Michael Krasny on @KQEDForum:

Today is the only federal holiday designated as a national day of service. It is only appropriate that we honor Dr. King by encouraging all Americans to volunteer to improve their communities. Thank you to all the volunteers in San Jose today who embraced the spirit of Dr. King!

@SpeakerPelosi has delivered on our #ForThePeople agenda at every step. The House passed over 400 bills last year. More than 275 are bipartisan. They're sitting on @senatemajldr's desk. Perhaps you two will go down as the laziest Senate Majority Leader and President in history.
It’s about time Congress exercised its war powers authority under the Constitution. This is long overdue.
Tune in to our press conference!
I believe the Constitution is the soul of our nation, and by defending it, we are saying we will not be soulless.

UPDATE: Covered California extended their deadline for health coverage starting on January 1st to Friday, Dec. 20th. If you’re a Californian and do not receive health insurance through your employer, you should visit http://CoveredCA.com. #OpenEnrollment

REMINDER: Covered California’s open enrollment for coverage beginning January 1st ends on December 15th! If you’re a Californian and do not receive health insurance through your employer, you should visit http://CoveredCA.com to sign up for health insurance. #OpenEnrollment
Proud to pass H.R. 3 to #LowerDrugCostsNow. My floor speech on this historic legislation:

The application deadline for spring internships in my Palo Alto and Washington, D.C. offices is December 7th. College students with ties to the 18th Congressional District are strongly encouraged to apply! https://eshoo.house.gov/constituent-services/student-internships/

Throughout my service in Congress, I've worked to increase research and funding for #PancreaticCancer, one of the deadliest of cancers. On #WPCD I renew my support for patients, survivors, & their families. Thank you @PanCAN advocates for inspiring me & raising hope every day.

REMINDER: It’s Open Enrollment season! It’s time to renew your health insurance coverage for 2020. Free in-person help is available. To sign up, call CoveredCA at (800) 300-1506. You can also apply at http://CoveredCA.com before Dec 15th for coverage starting on Jan 1st.
I can hear the words of Benjamin Franklin when he emerged from Independence Hall and was asked what they’d produced inside: “A Republic, if you can keep it.”

I’m witnessing history today as I listen to the testimony of Ambassador Yovanovitch, the daughter of parents who fled the Nazi and Soviet regimes. She has given 33 years in service to the U.S., most recently in Ukraine.

My Health Subcommittee advanced strong, comprehensive legislation today to reverse the youth e-cigarette epidemic and drive down youth tobacco use. We must continue to do everything we can to address the leading cause of preventable death and illness in the U.S.

TUNE IN: You can watch the House Intelligence Committee’s first public hearing of the impeachment inquiry. Two senior diplomats from the State Department will present testimony before Members and the American public:

We owe so much to our service members and veterans, and I hope you’ll take a moment today to bow your head and quietly give thanks to our great patriots for their service and love of country. https://eshoo.house.gov/news-stories/e-newsletters/veterans-day-2019-newsletter/

As a Member of Congress, I strive every day to honor their commitment to the United States by ensuring the health and well-being of the more than 25,000 veterans in our Congressional District and the more than 19 million veterans across our country.
On Veterans Day we remember with unending gratitude those who have worn the uniform to defend our country and Constitution. Because of their immense sacrifices, we enjoy liberty and freedom.

Bravo @Apple, @Google & @Facebook for stepping up to create affordable housing in our region. The public & private sectors must work together to address the housing & homelessness crises, and their combined sums of $4.5 billion advance this cause mightily.

Proud to introduce the Online Privacy Act w/ @RepZoeLofgren to protect every American's right to privacy. Our legislation ensures you have control over your own data, companies are held accountable, and the government provides tough but fair oversight.

I thought of my parents and grandparents yesterday as the House voted to formally recognize the Armenian Genocide. This resolution honors and commemorates my ancestors and all those who perished in the first genocide of the 20th century.
This resolution not only honors and commemorates my ancestors who perished but all those who were lost in the first genocide of the 20th Century. #ArmenianGenocide

49 U.S. states and over 2 dozen countries, including 14 NATO allies, have passed Genocide Resolutions. It’s time for Congress to act. There is an historic parallel today as Turkey is once again engaging in ethnic cleansing, this time against the Kurds in Syria.
Members of my own family were among those murdered, and my parents fled with my grandparents to America. What all of the persecuted had in common was that they were Christians.

Between 1915 and 1923, 1.5 million Armenians, and hundreds of thousands of Assyrians, Greeks, Syriacs, Arameans, Maronites, and other Christians were systematically slaughtered at the hands of the Ottoman Empire.
Today the House will vote on a resolution affirming the U.S. record on the Armenian Genocide. I’ve been waiting for this moment since I first came to Congress 27 years ago.

Today, October 21st, and Tuesday, October 22nd, I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking with you!

This year, almost a million people could receive additional financial help from @CoveredCA to lower the cost of their health insurance. To determine if you qualify for financial assistance for your health care in 2020, visit

Covered California’s open enrollment time has arrived! If you are a Californian and do not receive health insurance through your employer, you can visit http://CoveredCA.com to enroll in health insurance for 2020.
Brava!

Without direct government negotiation, American prescription drug prices have soared. The annual cost of prescription drugs rose 58% over just five years. It’s time to put aside partisanship and pass #HR3 to lower the cost of prescription drugs for every American. #LowerDrugCosts

Congress can bring down the price of Rx drugs and save billions by passing #HR3. It allows Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies and extends lower prices for medications to every American. #LowerDrugCosts
... the complexities of the Middle East. More civilian casualties, more displacement, and an emboldened Russia and ISIS will be the legacy of Donald Trump’s foreign policy.

I’m appalled by the President’s decision to once again put the interests of foreign dictators ahead of U.S. national security and our foreign allies. Allowing Turkey to launch a military offensive in Syria is reckless and further confirms that the President does not understand...
The relevant Committees will be issuing subpoenas to Ambassador Sondland for his testimony and documents. To follow updates on the impeachment inquiry, you can visit my website:
Today the Trump Administration barred Ambassador Gordon Sondland from appearing before investigators in Congress. The White House’s interference is an obstruction of Congress’ impeachment inquiry.
Tune-in to our hearing on #GunViolence as a public health issue

I look forward to chairing tomorrow’s hearing in Chicago for a community-centered discussion on ways to reduce gun violence that has become all too common throughout our country. Thank you @RepBobbyRush for your leadership and welcoming us to your district.

I fully support the Speaker’s announcement of a new impeachment inquiry. The circumstances surrounding the President’s phone call with a foreign leader requires it and we are obligated to go wherever the facts lead.
Congress must obtain the whistleblower complaint to assess if the President asked a foreign power to interfere in our election.
DNI Maguire shall provide Congress with the whistleblower complaint against the President, which the Intelligence Community Inspector General has deemed both "urgent" and "credible."

On Thursday, September 26th the Acting Director of National Intelligence (DNI) Joseph Maguire will appear before the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence. What is required of him by law is crystal clear—

Too many Americans are left w/ unaffordable bills for medications they need to survive. House Democrats are moving to rein in out-of-control drug prices for all Americans. I look forward to chairing next week’s hearing to advance the Lower Drug Costs Now Act

The Trump Admin’s #PublicCharge rule punishes immigrants who lawfully use Medicaid, housing vouchers, & food stamps, forcing millions of immigrant families to choose b/w their legal status and health. That's why I signed the #TriCaucus amicus brief to oppose this unfair rule.

Tomorrow, September 18th, and Thursday, September 19th, I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking to you!

both those who were there at the World Trade Center on 9/11 as well as all those who risked their lives in the months of clean-up that followed. Our nation is eternally grateful for their sacrifice. We must #NeverForget.
Congress passed a permanent reauthorization of the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund Act this July. The law ensures there will be permanent support for all 9/11 heroes and their families –

Eighteen years ago today will remain with us forever, when the unimaginable happened and almost 3,000 of our fellow Americans died in New York City, Washington, D.C., and outside of Shanksville, Pennsylvania.
We rely on China for pharmaceutical drugs. That’s a security threat. Find out more in my op-ed with @RepAdamSchiff
Good Riddance
This #LaborDay, we remember the progress made toward workers’ rights and recommit ourselves to fighting for the safety and dignity of working people. Happy Labor Day to all!

I’ve been a strong advocate of BART’s extension to Silicon Valley for over a decade. The $125 million investment to connect BART with Caltrain in the South Bay will relieve traffic congestion and support the continued growth of our region’s economy.

Thursday, August 29th I’m hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting for my constituents at Smithwick Theatre at Foothill Community College in Los Altos Hills. I look forward to seeing you there! Details below:
The courts have consistently upheld the rights of migrants in detention, and my hope is that they will overturn the Trump Administration’s inhumane rule.

After visiting detention centers at the southern border in July, it is clear the Trump Administration’s policies have exacerbated the humanitarian crisis. Today’s rule is yet another action to punish refugees.
No family, and certainly no child, should ever be subjected to indefinite detention, and this move by the Administration will create even more suffering.
The Trump Administration’s new rule to detain immigrant families indefinitely flies in the face of 20 years of judicial oversight to protect the human rights and dignity of families.

I applaud Planned Parenthood for their unfailing commitment to provide the best care and medical counsel available to their patients. Unlike the Trump Administration, they prioritize patients over politics.

Title X is the only federal grant program dedicated to providing family planning services to low-income and otherwise underserved communities. The Administration’s ill-begotten rules target and will hurt the most vulnerable women in our country.

The Trump Administration is reaping the discord they sow. By forcing a gag rule on health care providers that use #TitleX funding, the Administration is robbing nearly 1.5 million women of affordable, quality, and lifesaving care.
President Trump’s comments encouraging Israel to deny Members of Congress entry into Israel are borne out of ignorance, and it’s sad that Prime Minister Netanyahu took the bait.
Fact-finding trips to foreign countries are highly instructive for Members, and Israel should use this opportunity to engage in productive dialogue.
Israel’s decision to deny two sitting Members of Congress from entering the country is deeply disappointing and counterproductive to the special bond between the United States and Israel.

Thank you to all who spoke out against the mistreatment of immigrants and refugees on Tisha B’Av. We must continue to speak out and show up for the rights of immigrant families and our neighbors. #TishaBav
This action, and so many others, places the Trump Administration on the political endangered list.
Preserving the environment has been and continues to be a value of my constituents, and I will fight vigorously to retain this value and oppose all assaults on the ESA.

It passed Congress by nearly unanimous support in 1973 and was signed into law by President Nixon, a Republican. But today, the Trump Administration boastfully announced their intentions to weaken the ESA, and continue their relentless assault on the environment.

Bald eagles, grizzly bears, and American alligators have all been saved from extinction by the landmark law, the #EndangeredSpeciesAct (ESA), considered the most successful conservation law in America.
My biggest priority: get Sen. McConnell to #DoSomething. The House passed two bills in February to address gun violence, now the Senate must do its job.
My statement regarding the shootings in El Paso, Texas and Dayton, Ohio. #EnoughIsEnough

On Thursday, August 8th I’ll be hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting for my constituents at Cañada College Theater in Redwood City. Town Halls are a great opportunity to answer your questions and hear your concerns. Details below—I hope to see you there!
My statement on the shooting at the #GilroyGarlicFestival:

Sexual and reproductive health care is health care. I’m proud to support @UNFPA which provides critical support to over 150 countries. Our country must be a leader. Read our letter to Secretary of State Pompeo here

I’m proud to have shepherded the #AutismCARES Act through my Health Subcommittee to its passage in the House today. With renewed funding, we can continue the important work of gaining a greater understanding of autism.
Proud to cosponsor this important legislation!

Fifty years ago, scientists at @NASAAmes helped build the Apollo spacecraft that took the first humans to the moon. How proud I am of Ames and their key role in the Artemis program to return to the moon. #Apollo50th

I visited the border last weekend, and the treatment of detainees I witnessed can only be described as inhumane. I will continue to do everything I can to see that those who come to our borders as refugees are treated as nothing less than what they are: human beings.

I requested w/ 67 Members of Congress that the President demand Sec. of Labor Acosta’s resignation due to his involvement in striking a lenient plea deal in FL over a decade ago with an accused sexual abuser. Today Acosta announced he will step down as Sec. of Labor. Amen.
Reminder to join my Telephone Town Hall Meeting tonight at 6:45 p.m. PDT. You can tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to hearing from you!

Wednesday, July 10th, and Wednesday, July 17th, I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking to you! https://vekeo.com/repannaeshoo/

I’m excited to launch the fifth annual Congressional App Challenge and invite high school students in the 18th Congressional District to participate. Visit my website to learn more and to enter the challenge. Happy coding! #CongressionalAppChallenge

Brava to the USA #WorldCup19 Champions! Special shout out to the three former Stanford players on the team—@tierna_davidson, @kelleymohara, & @ChristenPress (Tierna & @AbbyDahlkemper were also raised in Menlo Park). The 18th Congressional District & the country are proud of you!
I wish every constituent a restful and happy Fourth of July. Happy Birthday America!
Proud to support the U.S. Women’s National Soccer Team @USWNT

#ICYMI: The President signed #PAHPA into law last week to strengthen our country’s existing preparedness and response programs that protect public health and national security. Grateful to @SusanWBrooks for moving this through Congress with me.

The fight continues today—I voted with #pride last month to pass the Equality Act, which amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and other existing laws to ensure that LGBT individuals are afforded the same protections against discrimination as every other American. #PrideMonth2019

In 1969, the Stonewall riots took place in Manhattan, igniting the Gay Liberation Movement in the United States. They inspired LGBT Pride Month and the call for equality for LGBT Americans. #Stonewall50

On Saturday, June 29th I’ll be hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting at the San Jose City Hall. Town Halls give me the opportunity to answer your questions and hear your concerns. Details below—I hope to see you there!

Today is #WorldRefugeeDay, and I'm proud to support bipartisan legislation introduced by @RepTedLieu @MarioDB @RepJoeNeguse @RepZoeLofgren reaffirming the U.S. commitment to protect refugees and displaced peoples. #StandWithRefugees #WRD2019

On #Juneteenth we commemorate the end of slavery in the U.S. when all remaining slaves in Texas were freed on June 19, 1865. As we celebrate these hard-earned freedoms, we must remember what we need to do in our day and time to ensure a more equal and inclusive America.

I'm thrilled to have @RepDougCollins join me as the new Co-Chair of the Congressional Internet Caucus. We’re committed to ensuring Members of Congress and their staff are educated about the promise and potential of the #internet

Thirty Six years ago today, Sally Ride became the first American woman in space. She was a trailblazer in math and science, and a @Stanford grad to boot. How proud I am of our Congressional District’s history of fostering visionaries like Sally!

Congratulations to Christine Lee of Saratoga, & Edward Jung & Melody Choi of San Jose on being selected for the 2019 National Youth Orchestra. These talented violinists from CA-18 will perform internationally & in the U.S. with the most promising musicians in our country. Bravo!

Transfusions of blood and blood products save millions of lives every year. Celebrate #WorldBloodDonorDay2019 by making a blood donation at a blood bank near you. To learn more about donating, click below:

Our country needs a 21st century commitment to biomedical research, and I’m proud to see California receive $4.2 billion from @NIH. The 18th Congressional District is the 2nd highest recipient of NIH grants in California!

My Health Subcommittee examined proposals today to end surprise medical billing by protecting patients from payment disagreements between providers and insurers. An unplanned visit to the E.R. should never leave insured patients with thousands of dollars in debt.

Surprise medical bills occur when patients are caught between insurers and health care providers, and too often it leaves them with exorbitant debts that can wreak havoc on family finances when they learn they were treated by an out-of-network physician.

During #PrideMonth, we celebrate the victories and remember the losses on the long march to equality. Three years ago today, 49 lives were lost in the #Pulse Nightclub massacre. Take time to remember the victims. My thoughts are with their families today.

It’s an honor to be part of the Congressional Delegation to Normandy to commemorate the #DDay75thAnniversary. Buried in the Normandy American Cemetery are more than 9,300 of our military who gave their lives to protect our democracy and the freedoms we have.

Yesterday we passed the #DreamAndPromiseAct in the House to protect Dreamers and refugees seeking asylum in our country. America is the only country most Dreamers have ever known, and it’s a worthy fight to give them the chance they deserve to earn citizenship.

Thirty years ago today, protesters supporting Democracy in #TiananmenSquare and elsewhere in China were attacked by their own government. The House passed a resolution today to remember the victims and to call on China to respect the human rights of all people.

I continue to be optimistic about #NetNeutrality because the majority of Americans—Democrats, Republicans, & Independents—all support a free and open internet. The House passed a bill to restore net neutrality, and now it’s time for the Senate to act.

Thank you to NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine and @NASAAmes for taking me on their lunar lander cab simulator and discussing their important work on the Artemis program to return to the moon by 2024. Bravo!

Tune in to my Town Hall Meeting with special guest FCC Commissioner @JRosenworcel! We’re discussing our fight to restore #netneutrality, eliminate robocalls, protect consumers, and any other topic that interests you. https://www.facebook.com/RepAnnaEshoo/

I’m holding a Town Hall Meeting with special guest @JRosenworcel tomorrow, May 30th in Campbell to discuss our fight to restore #netneutrality, eliminate robocalls, protect consumers, & any other topic that interests you. Please register in advance:

Love the internet? Hate robocalls? Feel that consumers should always come first? Join me and @JRosenworcel for a Town Hall Meeting on 5/30 in Campbell to discuss #NetNeutrality , illegal robocalls, and our work to protect consumers. Register here: https://to.ly/1zkRr

@EnergyCommerce is considering the #LIFTAmerica Act today, a sweeping infrastructure package to rebuild America through investments to combat climate change, expand broadband access, & protect public health & the environment. My newsletter has the details https://to.ly/1zgpm

We also examined legislation to ensure low-income Medicare enrollees can afford their drugs by eliminating cost-sharing for generic drugs and capping out-of-pocket costs for other drugs. This legislation not only saves seniors money, it can also save lives. #drugprices

Secret decisions and deals in the drug supply chain lead to unaffordable drug prices. Today my Health Subcommittee considered bipartisan legislation to: 1. Stop the deals that drive up costs for consumers, and 2. Require drug manufacturers to justify price hikes

100 years ago today, the House voted to pass the 19th Amendment which granted women the right to vote. We remember and celebrate the suffragists and their allies, both famous and unknown, for relentlessly pursuing a more perfect Union. #WomensVote100
"On the heels of not being able to overturn the Affordable Care Act in Congress, Trump and Barr have taken a sledgehammer to health care in our country."

Yesterday I spoke at the Stanford Government Lecture Series. I appreciated the opportunity to share my experiences and engage with undergraduate students about the challenges of Congressional policymaking. @StanfordinGov @haascenter
I am unendingly grateful for my Mother’s goodness and wisdom. Happy #MothersDay to all Moms in our Congressional District.
Not on my watch, Mr. Trump! We protect, not pollute, frack or drill.
As the daughter of a lifelong small businessman, I’m as committed as ever to policies that strengthen the backbone of our national economy—small businesses. #NationalSmallBusinessWeek

California’s 18th Congressional District is home to some of the world’s most innovative startups and it’s a shining example of the critical role small businesses play in our local and national economy.
Calling all computer, electrical, and mechanical engineers in the 18th District! The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office is recruiting in San Jose this weekend. Details below:

I’m proud my bipartisan bill, the Purple Book Continuity Act, passed unanimously in the House yesterday as the first piece of legislation this Congress to address drug pricing. My speech on the House floor:

Magnificent artwork from talented high school artists in our District! Congratulations to Jenny Shi on being chosen by a panel of local artists as the winner of the #CongressionalArtCompetition. Her artwork will be displayed in our nation's Capitol for a full year.

May is #AsianPacificHeritageMonth to celebrate the AAPI community. In our District, Stanford Professor Dr. Stephanie Chao is an advocate for children’s health & will be honored at the NBC Bay Area & AACI Asian Pacific American Heritage Month Awards. Brava!

Nearly 200 nations signed the Paris Agreement to transition to a low-carbon economy and stop global warming. Trump wants to pull the U.S. out, so I voted for #HR9 today to keep our country in the agreement and at the center of energy innovation. #ClimateActionNow

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we pause to remember one of the worst atrocities committed in history. The Holocaust claimed the lives of six million Jews and millions more. We remember their legacy, and we reaffirm our commitment to #NeverAgain let hatred fuel such heinous crimes.

It was a pleasure to meet with Dr. Steven Artandi, Director of @StanfordCancer. We discussed federal funding for @NIH and the National Cancer Institute, and the important work Stanford is doing to care for patients with cancer in our community.

Americans were subjected to 48 billion robocalls last year & the harassment worsens daily. @EnergyCommerce held a hearing on 2 of my bills today to close loopholes & strengthen oversight to stop the incessant calls. It's time to crack down on robocallers & end predatory practices
On behalf of all those I represent, our prayers are with the Chabad of Poway and the family of Lori Gilbert-Kaye. This heinous act of hatred must be rejected by acts of conscience across our country.

On #ArborDay we celebrate the gift of the beautiful variety of trees in the 18th District, California, & throughout our country. As stewards of our environment, my hope is that thousands of trees will be planted for future generations to enjoy & cherish http://tinyw.in/RZwk

I’ve cosponsored the Armenian Genocide Resolution in every Congress I’ve served in to formally recognize one of history’s human atrocities. The United States should join those in the world community that formally recognize the #ArmenianGenocide.

Today we remember the 1.5 million lives lost during the Armenian Genocide. We can never allow time to diminish the cruelty and violence perpetuated by the Ottoman Empire against Armenians, Assyrians, Greeks, and other minorities. We carry the victims' history & honor their legacy

This #EarthDay, let’s look at the facts. A recent study says there’s a 99.9999% chance that humans are the cause of global warming. Our actions have consequences, and Congress must pass comprehensive legislation to protect our planet for future generations http://tinyw.in/QXnp
Deeply saddened by the heinous attacks against Christians as they celebrated Easter and tourists in Sri Lanka. My heartfelt condolences to all those affected by this senseless violence.
Bravo to the Coast Guard for their bravery and heroism. They executed an amazing rescue under difficult conditions to save two lives. Thank you for your service!
It’s National Public Safety Telecommunicators Week. My unending gratitude to all the dispatchers in California’s 18th District and across the country who work 24/7 to keep our communities safe!
My statement regarding Special Counsel Mueller’s report:

Bravo to Nathan Tan on earning a Silver Medal Congressional Award. His community service as a Boy Scout Senior Patrol Leader, participating in local clean-ups, and learning about the history and environment of our District is exemplary. Congratulations, Nathan!

On #TaxDay 2019, I wonder if President Trump has filed his tax returns just as millions of Americans have. The House passed my bill requiring him and all future presidents to release their tax returns. The American people deserve transparency.

My heart is heavy as are the hearts of millions around the world to see the 850 year old Cathedral of Notre Dame engulfed in flames. May the people of the world work with the people of France to rebuild it.

The House passed legislation during the first #100DaysForThePeople to: •Fight corruption #ForThePeopleAct •Close the gender pay gap #PaycheckFairnessAct •Restore Net Neutrality #SaveTheNetAct •Ensure background checks #HR8 “I've got new rules, I count 'em ” - @DUALIPA

Across America, 86% of the American people—Democrats, Republicans, Independents—support #NetNeutrality. Proud to pass the #SaveTheNet Act today to stop Internet Service Providers from throttling, blocking, and paid prioritization.

The #SaveTheNet Act will: Restore popular, bipartisan #NetNeutrality protections Promote a free & open internet Empower the FCC to be the ‘cop on the beat’ to ensure the internet remains open & free Proud to be a net neutrality warrior & vote on the bill this week!

The legacy left by Sec. Nielsen? Thousands of children inhumanely separated from their families. The new DHS Secretary must address the humanitarian crisis at our border, not add to the chaos and cruelty.

From 2014 to 2016, programs funded by #VAWA provided legal assistance to an average of 28,553 victims of domestic and sexual violence every 6 months. I voted today to continue this service and create new programs for survivors by reauthorizing #VAWA4ALL

The Violence Against Women Act has helped survivors of domestic & sexual violence through legal resources, housing, & health care for 25 years. Today the House passed an updated #VAWA after Republicans shamefully allowed it to expire last December.

The House just passed a resolution condemning the Trump Administration’s recent actions to seek the invalidation of every provision of the #AffordableCareAct. We will fight this Administration’s sabotage and do everything to protect, defend, and improve the #ACA.

A Joint Session of Congress met today and welcomed @NATO Secretary General @jensstoltenberg to underscore the critical importance of the most consequential alliance established post WWII that has successfully kept the peace since its inception 70 years ago. #NATO

Today is the day women’s wages catch up to what men were paid in the previous year. The Senate must join the House in passing the #PaycheckFairnessAct so every American receives equal pay for equal work. #EqualPayDay

My thanks to the over 3,200 people who participated in last week's Tele-Town Halls. I will continue to call into every community in our Congressional District, so stay tuned for future calls. Listen to past Town Halls and sign up for future events here!

Today I voted to reject the President’s ban on transgender troops in the military. The brave men and women who serve our country to protect our freedoms should never be subjected to such bigotry. #ProtectTransTroops #TransVisibilityWeek

“The equivalent of a nuclear bomb fell on our country when the president said what he said this week,” Representative Anna G. Eshoo said Wednesday as her House subcommittee began pushing through health care legislation. “This is deadly serious.”

On average, a woman makes only 80 cents for every dollar earned by her white male counterpart. Help is on the way! The House passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct today, requiring companies to prove that pay disparities exist for legitimate reasons not based on gender alone.

Reminder to join my fourth Telephone Town Hall Meeting tonight at 6:45 p.m. PDT. You can tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to hearing from you! https://vekeo.com/repannaeshoo/

Last week I met with student ambassadors from our District who are working to end police brutality and corruption in Haiti. The students from Los Altos High School inspired me with their stories and advocacy to lift up the Haitian people and address government corruption.
Today @EnergyCommerce took up the #SaveTheNet Act, a 3-page bill which delivers popular, bipartisan #NetNeutrality protections. The fight for a free and open internet continues in the people's House!

Today, March 25th, and Wednesday, March 27th, I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking to you!
My statement regarding Attorney General Barr’s summary of the Mueller report
My statement regarding Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s report to Attorney General William Barr

A third of uninsured Americans aren’t taking their medicine as prescribed because prices are unaffordable. Unacceptable! My Health Subcommittee considered seven bills last week on drug pricing and we will produce legislation to bring down drug prices.

March is #WomensHistoryMonth! 2019 has brought 131 women to serve in Congress—the largest number in U.S. history, and we stand on the shoulders of women who fought for equality and access to opportunity. Jeannette Rankin was one such woman, the first elected to the House in 1916

My thanks to the over 3,800 people who participated in last week's Tele-Town Halls. Stay tuned for two calls next week on Monday, March 25 and Wednesday, March 27. You can listen to last week's town halls and sign up for future calls here! https://vekeo.com/repannaeshoo/

It was exciting to meet with 80 students last Friday who were part of the global #YouthClimateStrike. I’m so proud of their advocacy to save our planet from environmental destruction and inspired by their passion. Bravo!

On behalf of the people of California’s 18th Congressional District, we join the world community in mourning New Zealand’s loss of lives. We reaffirm our condemnation of all forms of hatred and intolerance, and we carry the families of the victims in our hearts and in our prayers

It’s hard to believe that 29 states allow housing and employment discrimination based on sexual orientation & 30 states lack non-discrimination laws for gender identity. I'm cosponsoring the #EqualityAct to protect the civil rights of LGBT people across every state in our country

Reminder to join my second Telephone Town Hall Meeting tonight at 6:45 p.m. PST. You can tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to hearing from you! https://vekeo.com/repannaeshoo/

#ThatMomentWhen Trump’s Secretary of Health acts like his budget isn’t taking a hatchet to every part of our health care system, undermining the Affordable Care Act, block granting Medicaid, and slashing Medicare spending. I’ve got receipts, Secretary Azar.

My House Committee held a hearing today to discuss the Save the Internet Act. I’m cosponsoring this 3-page, common-sense bill to restore #NetNeutrality and #SaveTheNet. To keep the Internet free and open, we must pass this bill.

Today, March 11th, and Wednesday, March 13th, I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PST. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking to you! https://vekeo.com/repannaeshoo/

On #InternationalWomensDay, I’m grateful for the advancement of women around the world, but women still face major challenges. Discriminatory laws limit women’s opportunity. Governments must act to uphold equality and close the opportunity gap.

My statement regarding H. Res. 183 - Condemning anti-Semitism and anti-Muslim Bigotry
Today I’m proud to introduce new legislation to restore Net Neutrality protections that were repealed by Trump’s FCC. We must #SaveTheNet and keep it open to all Americans without any manipulations.

Wonderful meeting with the @BLMca team, the Amah Mutsun Tribal Band, and Santa Cruz Supervisor @RyanCoonerty on the Cotoni-Coast Dairies lands last Friday to receive an update on the efforts to create public access to this National Monument.

Last week I met with @NIHDirector and the new Director of @NIBIBgov, Dr. Tromberg. My bipartisan legislation created NIBIB to advance biomedical technology for breakthroughs in medicine. Fascinating discussion on how @NIH is harnessing new technology to find cures for Americans
